Bhopal bakes in hottest June day ever at.description: BHOPAL/INDORE: June was never this blistering in Bhopal - and this is no patiabazi. At 46 degrees Celsius, Friday was the hottest June day ever in the state capital. On the same day, Indore baked in the hottest day of the season at 44 degrees. The wait for monsoon is going to be long and torturous. For Bhopalis, even indoors or sundown is no comfort as the mercury stood at 43 degrees even at 8pm on Friday. And with the minimum temperature at 32.5 degrees - six degrees above normal - there is just no respite from the heat. Hot winds swept through the city at 24kmph, leaving streets deserted. There is a heat wave warning for Saturday. Thursday had enough indication of the torture that was to come at sunrise. Even at midnight, hot winds swept through the city, turning homes into bhattis. At 5.30am on Friday, the mercury stood at 33 degrees. By noon, it was 43 degrees and soon it touched the record of 46 degrees - a searing seven degrees above normal. The worst isn't over yet. The weekend may be hotter still. To put it in perspective, the hottest day ever recorded in Bhopal was 46.7 degrees. We aren't far from that, and monsoon is a fortnight away. As per Met records, the highest ever June temperature recorded in Bhopal before this was 45.6 degrees Celsius on June 10, 1979, and June 5, 1995. Several BJP leaders injured after stage.description: INDORE: Several BJP leaders — including Indore MP Shankar Lalwani, mayor Malini Gaud, Mhow MLA Usha Thakur and former MLA Rajesh Sonkar — were injured when a stage erected to welcome the 'Akrosh Rally’ of party general secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya collapsed in Rajmohalla area on Tuesday. The stage could not bear the load of people who climbed atop to be seen with the stalwarts and caved in, taking down all the leaders, and sparking panic in the crowd. BJP workers pulled the injured leaders out of the wreckage. Luckily, there were ambulances standing by for the high-profile event. Gaud, Thakur and Sonkar were taken to hospital. Sonkar has been hospitalised with injuries to his back and head. Gaud and Thakur sustained minor injuries on their limbs. Indore-5 MLA Mahendra Hardia suffered injuries on his legs. Recently elected Indore MP Shankar Lalwani, who was also present on stage, sustained minor injuries to his limbs. Forget queues, now pay traffic fines onl.description: INDORE: Traffic violators would no longer have to wait in long queues to pay fine against e-challans issued for traffic rule violations as city traffic police are planning to launch a website to collect fines from violators online. Currently, after receiving e-challan for red light violation, violators are required to deposit compounding amount at cash collection centre of traffic police station at MTH Compound. Officials said that a fresh proposal in this regard has been sent to state government for approval. "The proposal is meant to provide easy payment options to commuters. They would also be able to check if any fine slip or challan is pending in their name," said ASP (traffic) Mahendra Kumar Jain. He said that online payment option for motorists would make it easy for them to clear fines on time. "This would also help us reduce dues related with pending challans," he added. This proposal comes after officials found that commuters were facing difficulty in paying e-challans issued through red light violation detection (RLVD) system. "Many commuters, especially office-goers face difficulty in paying fines by visiting cash collection centre. This leads to delay in payment and increase in number of challans pending in name of commuters," said officials. One an average, 1000 motorists are issued e-challans through RLVD system for violations like signal jumping, riding without helmet, triple-ride, wrong registration plate etc. However, hardly 30 per cent violators turn up to clear their dues, and rest of the challans remains unpaid. More than 50,000 challans are already pending in name of motorists. Authorities had earlier announced to launch a mobile application for the same purpose, but the plan could not be materialized. Now, they have decided to launch a website to provide an online option for motorists to pay their fine against e-challans issued to them. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Thirty 'unsafe' institutes asked to shut.description: INDORE: Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) on Friday issued closure notices to 30 educational institutions, mostly coaching centres operating in congested areas for failing to abide by fire safety and emergency norms. The list also includes around half a dozen private institutions, which were found to be running in buildings that do not fulfil basic fire safety norms. The action comes two weeks after at least 20 people were killed in a massive fire that broke out at a four-storeyed building, housing a coaching centre in Surat. IMC had the very next day launched a survey operation to check if educational institutes operational in multi-storeyed buildings fulfil fire safety and emergency norms. "None of these 30 institutions fulfil basic fire safety and emergency norms as prescribed under Land Development Rules 2012, on basis of which closure notices have been issued to all these institutions," said IMC commissioner Asheesh Singh. He said that during the survey, it was found that there is no scope of improvement in any of the buildings, where these institutions are running. So all of them have been instructed to shut down and vacate space within 24 hours. Apart from issuing notices to these 30 institutions, the civic body has also shortlisted over 120 institutions, which do not have adequate fire safety and emergency arrangements. Officials however found that there is a scope of improvement in buildings, where these institutions are being run. "These institutions will also be given notices to improve fire safety arrangements within a week. Upon failure, similar action would be initiated against them as well," they added. 15 monkeys die due to heat stroke, water.description: DEWAS: Around 15 monkeys died possibly due to heatstroke in Joshi Baba forest range in Bagli, Dewas. The group met the tragic fate as another group of monkeys allegedly controlled the nearby water source and didn't allow the group to access it. Forest officials have even admitted burning the decomposing carcasses of some monkeys fearing that they might have died of some infection. "The bodies were decomposing; we have to take all precautions. We have burnt few carcasses," said District Forest Official, PN Mishra. "The nearby water source is controlled by another group of monkeys that didn't let this group of monkey's access water, which might have resulted in their death," said Mishra. He said that adequate arrangements of water are being made for the wild animals and the viscera of the dead monkeys has been sent to the laboratory for examination. Airport robot will get glass case to kee.description: INDORE: Tampered with by passengers, the recently introduced passenger service robot at Devi Ahilyabai Holkar Airport of Indore is now going to get a 'glass enclosure'. The enclosure would be meant to restrict passengers especially children from interfering with its functions. A decision in this regard has been taken by airport officials after passengers especially kids started tampering with the functions of the robot. The robot was introduced at the airport in January this year for passengers' assistance in case of lost baggage and also to provide emergency contacts. It welcomes the passenger on sensing presence of an individual by a voice command. It works in two modes - welcome mode and information mode with the help of a toggle switching option. Officials were also in process to upgrade the robot to provide flight related information to passengers. However, passengers within a few months after it was placed in arrival area of the airport started interfering with functions of the robot. Airport director Aryama Sanyal said that they found arriving passengers particularly kids interfering with functions of the robot. "We are left with no option but to keep the robot in a closed enclosure to prevent any interference with its functioning," she said. She said that the enclosure would not hamper functioning of the robot and it would also be visible to passengers. "We are preparing the size estimates for the enclosure and suitable location where it can be placed," she added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." In Video:CM Mamata accepts proposal of doctors to set up Grievance Redressal CellDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Probe ordered against TI for \u2018misbe.description: BARWANI: SP Barwani has ordered a probe against Rajpur town inspector for allegedly abusing and misbehaving with women, who were returning home after listening to Bhagwat Katha on Saturday night, and thrashing small vendors. The investigation was ordered after a delegation of BJP workers led by Khargone MP Gajendra Patel complained against the town inspector Anil Bamaniya on Sunday. They handed over a memorandum to the SP against Bamaniya. They alleged that Bamniya used to consume liquor and misbehave with owners of small stall like tea, pan, ice cream and snacks. On Saturday night too, he abused and misbehaved with women, who were returning home after listening to Bhagwat Katha. MP Patel asked the SP to inform him about the action to be taken in the case. He has also sent copies of memorandum to director general of police, IG Indore and Khargone DIG. Superintendent of police DR Teniwar told TOI that primary inquiry will be done by Barwani additional superintendent of police Sunita Rawat. He will take appropriate action in the case after receiving the probe report. BJP district president Om Khandelwal said that Bamaniya was behaving like British officials with the small vendors. On the other hand, TI Bamaniya told TOI that BJP leaders were against him because he had stopped selling of liquor illegally in the area. “On Saturday night, few people vandalized a liquor shop and thrashed its workers. Police have booked five people under sections 294, 323, 506, 427 and 34 of the IPC and Excise Act,” he claimed. During Lok Sabha elections, he was transferred from Rajpur for violation of model code of conduct. A few days ago, he was again shifted back to Rajpur. \nGuests enjoy forest theme party at Kyr.description: There is no doubt that the EDM (Electronic Dance Music) scene in Indore is soaring and with international deejays like DJ Apster and Mafiza playing at Kyro, the place is becoming a hub for the city’s partygoers. Kyro is now also bringing some quirky themes to its venue and its recent party, which was hosted around the forest theme, had the audience swaying on the dance floor.  The entire ambience of the lounge was turned into a mini jungle with neon lights and artificial jungle leaves brought alive the true feeling of partying in a jungle. Adding to this was the tribal beat music of US-based DJ Apster, who made everyone groove to electrifying music.  On receiving a positive response to this theme, Kyro is going to host yet another party today, with famous South African DJ Mafiza, who is known for her systemic music all over the world. DJ Mafiza has played at some of the most rocking international parties and will now be captivating the party scene of the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. After barrage of criticism, Railway scra.description: INDORE: No, you won't get a 'champi' on any train from Indore. Western railway on Saturday scrapped the decision to introduce head and foot massages on trains after it was bombarded with objections and criticism. "The proposal to introduce head and/or foot massage services on trains originating from Indore station was initiated by Ratlam Division. As soon as the proposal came to the notice of higher authorities of Western Railways, it was withdrawn," said a press release, issued by Western Railway CPRO Ravinder Bhakar. Western Railway appreciates the "positive suggestions" from public representatives, railway consumers and public, it added. On June 8, DRM R N Sunkar tweeted that Ratlam Division was going to start massage service on 39 trains to "add to passenger comfort". It went viral, and made for eye-popping headlines but triggered outrage in certain sections. On Friday, outgoing Lok Sabha Speaker Sumitra Mahajan wrote to railway minister Piyush Goyal, seeking 'clarity' on the plan. She pointed out that it would make women passengers uncomfortable. "It may throw up some questions regarding the safety of passengers, especially women," she wrote, and wanted to know if permission had been sought from the railway ministry. Earlier, newly-crowned Indore MP Shankar Lalwani had objected to it and written to Goyal on June 13, saying that it's "against Indian culture to offer such services in presence of women". "In my opinion, providing passengers medical aid and doctors is important and not these 'standard-less' services," Lalwani wrote. "Based on feedback from public, and considering social and economic conditions and improvement of passenger services, the proposed (massage) facility has been put up for review. Along with the proposed head and foot massage facility on running trains, tender for the same facility at Indore railway station has also been cancelled," senior PRO of Ratlam Division Jitendra Kumar Jayant told TOI. Soil survey for better yield begins in I.description: INDORE: Aimed at increasing productivity and guiding farmers to harvest appropriate crops to reap maximum benefits, the agriculture department has launched a survey to identify quality of soil. “The department has selected Asrawadkhurd village for the survey under Soil Health Card Scheme. It has started taking samples of every farm in the village to check its quality and prepare the report. The report card will help farmers increase their productivity by balancing nutrients and other factors of soil. Based on the report, the farmers will be given tips to go for appropriate crops to get good harvest,” agriculture joint director Vijay Jaat said. The card will contain report of soil’s health and level of nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium, magnesium, sulphur and other nutrients. It will also prescribe appropriate fertilizers, seeds and techniques to make a good balance of nutrients in soil, he added. Asrawadkhurd farmers have been asked for farming at half of the agricultural land in their traditional way and use guidance provided by the department in the remaining area. The harvest of both the methods will be compared to know benefits from the scheme. Subsequently, farmers will be encouraged to opt for better one. “Asrawadkhurd has been selected on pilot basis to test soil’s health. It will help farmers getting better harvest. On success of the project, the survey will be carried out in other villages,” Jaat said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nFrom cricket to cycling, youngsters co.description: It was an afternoon dedicated to music and dance as 30 enthusiastic dancers from the city came together for a parade titled Heart Fest recently.  Fascinated by glamorous reality shows, these amateur dancers showcased genres as varied as Bollywood style, hip-hop, abstract and jazz. And judging this enthusiastic bunch were twins Prayag and Prayas, dancers/actors who have been working under the guidance of Remo D’souza in Mumbai and have done many TV shows.  The duo traces its roots to Dewas and since it is quite close to Indore, they would often come to the city for events earlier. Speaking to us about their current visit, they said, “It feels nice to come back to our roots and that too, as judges. This dance competition is only reminding us of our days in Indore when we used to participate, just like these kids. We have been part of a series of competitions and that struggle helped us grow, giving us the confidence to move to Mumbai.”  Talking about Indore, they added, “This city has a different charm. The love and opportunities that we got in Indore were extraordinary. In 2005, when we moved to Mumbai, the struggle didn’t look that difficult. We just threw ourselves in to dance and learned every possible thing we could .” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

15 monkeys die in fight over water in Ma.description: INDORE: In a grisly indicator of just how merciless the summer of 2019 is, 15 monkeys in Dewas’s Punjapura Range have been killed after losing to another band of monkeys in a fight for control of a pond. This entire region has been baking in 45-plus heat for the past week. Denied water, these monkeys died as their organs shut down due to dehydration. Shocked, the forest department is carrying out a behavioural study of monkeys in the region and has made water arrangements for the group that lost the fight. A cowherd spotted the carcasses on Friday and rushed to the nearby beat office. The alarm went out and senior forest officers scrambled to the scene. Initial autopsy showed that all the monkeys died due to heat stroke and consequent multi-organ failure. Foresters were puzzled because a pond was close by. Then, they saw a bigger band of monkeys, numbering 50-60, seemingly guarding the pond. “The water source was barely a few hundred meters from the cave where this group of monkeys lived. However, due to the dominance of another group, this group could not access the water source. To protect themselves from the heat, many monkeys entered the cave, but the rocks became hotter. Some of the weaker monkeys couldn’t get out of the cave, where they died,” DFO Dewas P N Mishra said. Forest officials have made provisions of water, jaggery and chickpeas for the defeated group. The carcasses were cremated, and viscera of some of the monkeys has been sent for forensic tests to Sagar to check for possible contagious infections. There are five to six groups of monkeys in the region where the deaths occurred. Foresters are surprised that territorial fights, or as in this case, a fight over water, could get so violent among monkeys. The Punjapura forest range has other herbivores, including deer, but no other fatalities due to dehydration have been reported. Forest officials have set up night vision trap-cameras to study the behaviour of monkeys and to check if any other factor contributed to the deaths. 26-year-old youth killed as bikes collid.description: INDORE: A 26-year-old youth was killed and his nephew sustained injuries when a speeding two-wheeler collided head-on with the bike they were riding on in Aerodrome area in front of Ankit Hospital on Saturday night. The youth, Vishwadeep, son of Raju and his nephew were on their way home to New Mahesh Nagar in Malharganj when the collision took place. The duo was rushed to MY Hospital, where Vishwadeep was declared brought dead by doctors. Vishwadeep’s family members and friends, who had reached MY Hospital, were so shocked and couldn’t believe that he had succumbed to injuries. They reportedly created nuisance at the hospital. They fought with the hospital staff and forcefully took Vishwadeep’s body to a private hospital to get him checked. But they were told that he had died a while ago. The video of youths carrying the body out of the hospital in their car to a private hospital, while shouting, went viral on social media and the hospital authority also informed police. They, however, later brought it back to MYH for postmortem examination. The body was handed over to family members only after postmortem examination.  Police have registered a case and the number of vehicle which had hit Vishwadeep’s bike was noted down based on CCTV footage. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. MP: One held for raping, killing 5-year-.description: INDORE: Ujjain police on Saturday arrested a man for allegedly raping and killing a 5-year-old girl after abducting her from a shanty where she was sleeping with her 8-member family in Bhukhi Mata area of the temple city. The accused, Shiva Rao Maratha, is a flower vendor outside Mahakal temple and lived in a hut adjacent to victim’s shanty, Ujjain SP Sachin Atulkar said at a press conference. Hours after her family reported missing, bloodied body of the girl was found floating in Kshpira river near a bridge, with injury marks on her private parts and head. A post-mortem examination confirmed that the girl was raped and stoned to death. Two bricks with blood on them were found at the river bank. The girl was sleeping with her family – parents, grandparents and four siblings aged 5-9 years – in a shanty near a brick kiln. She went missing between 2am and 5am. Soon after the murder came to fore, police teams interrogated people known to the family and neighbours. Shiva Rao Maratha could not give substantiate his whereabouts in the nights, following which he was grilled by a police team. He later confessed committing the crime. Maratha told police that he had broken into the shanty by removing some bricks near the makeshift door. The girl was sleeping closest to the door. He grabbed her and gaging her with his hand, dragged her out in the open. He confessed having taken the girl to the river bank and raping her. He later hit her head with bricks, killing her and disposing her body in the river. Police have booked Maratha under relevant sections of IPC and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

5-year-old abducted in sleep, stoned to.description: UJJAIN: A 5-year-old girl was abducted while she was sleeping with her family in a shanty at a brick kiln and stoned to death in Bhukhi Mata area early on Friday. While the police were searching for the girl, her bloodied body was found floating in Kshpira river near a bridge in the afternoon, with injury marks on her private parts and head. Police suspect that the attacker had attempted to rape her and fearing a backlash, stoned her to death before throwing the body in the river. "We have found two bricks with blood on them on the river bank. The bricks may be used to hit the girl, who had injury marks on her head and face," Mahakal police station in charge Arvind Singh Tomar told TOI. The girl was sleeping with her 8-member family - parents, grandparents and four siblings aged 5-9 years - in a shanty. The accommodation was provided by the brick kiln owner to the labourers, Tomar said adding around a dozen kilns operate in the area and hundreds of labourers from nearby regions work in them. At around 2 am, her grandfather woke up and claimed to have seen the girl sleeping, while holding on to her grandmother. At 5am, when he woke up again, the girl was missing. The grandfather raised an alarm and informed the police. A team of experts rushed to the spot with a dog squad. The dogs sniffed around in circles in 200 meter area from the shanty, the inspector said adding the family later informed that the victim played with her friends in the locality where the dogs were leading. While the search was on, report of a body of a girl found in Kshipra river came through. The family identified her as the victim. The body was later sent for a postmortem examination. "A three-member team of doctors has been formed to perform the autopsy. Initial report suggest injuries on her private parts, indicating sexual attack. The doctors are yet to confirm rape," Additional SP Neeraj Pandey said. The police were in the process of interrogating locals of the areas. Investigators believe that the accused must be known to the family and the girl. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nMaruti Ciaz Hybrid launched at a grand.description: The grand Maruti Bash at Vrindavan Garden, Sayaji was full of entertainment. Around 600-700 of Maruti's high profile customers and media financers were invited to commemorate the launch of the all new Maruti Ciaz Hybrid. The event began at 7.30 pm followed by enthralling dance performances and business presentations. There was also an exciting contest wherein people had to complete the slogan "I like Maruti because..." and the best description won an iPad. The evening was made more special by the 'Selfie treat' as all the invitees were given a framed selfie with the Ciaz Hybrid to take away as a memento.  Amidst all the enjoyment, the garden area of the venue was filled with talks of appreciation for the aerodynamically and fuel efficient car. The DDiS 200 diesel engine provisioned with an Integrated Starter Generator was a hot topic for discussion as well. The car is 4490 mm long, 1730 mm wide and has an overall height of 1485mm. To make the drive swifter, the wheelbase has been kept 2650 mm wide whereas the minimum ground clearance is about 170 mm. In order to avoid jerky turns, this car is provisioned with a turn radius of about 5.4 meters and the back is adorned with a boot space of 510 inches. The interior has highly modernised features like proficiently designed personal reading lamps, camera assisted reverse parking system, keyless push start, rear sunshades and intelligently featured rear AC vents. For a homely feeling and comfort, the interior has a satisfactory utility space and a comfortable seating space for five people. The stunning exterior and highly-equipped interior rendered the car as the showstopper of the event.  It's not just a swift car but also a safe one. The dual airbags can absorb jerks and shocks in the blink of an eye. Whereas the ABS along with EBD, the rear parking sensors, high tensile strength steel and TECT (Total Effective Control Technology) ensures maximum safety. The front brakes (ventilated disc), rear brakes (drum), rear suspension (torsion beam) and front suspension (McPherson strut) puts this car in sync with safety standards. There are varied colour shades available in the Maruti Ciaz Smart Hybrid including metallic, brown, pearl and dignity. You can choose the one that suits your style. High mileage, cost-effectiveness, a touch-screen infotainment system, Smartplay (tuned behind the wheels), safety and looks to die for, make this car a must buy during the festive season. Available at your nearest Maruti showrooms. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Registration for CET gets extension till.description: INDORE: Students can now register themselves for Common Entrance Test (CET) type I examination till June 15 with Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya (DAVV) extending the deadline as four new undergraduate courses have been added in Group A2 of CET type I. The new courses are BSc (electronics), BSc (hons) physics, BSc (hons) mathematics, BSc (hons) applied statistics and analytics. "Some of the new courses that have been cleared by executive council to be rolled out from this academic session have been added in CET type I examination. As there are 13 days remaining to conduct CET type I examination, we have extended last date of registration," media spokesperson of DAVV, Dr Chandan Gupta told TOI. The application fee is Rs 1500 and student, who has applied in group A2, will not have to apply again, he added. Currently, over 19000 students have applied for various DAVV courses out of which over 16000 applicants have registered themselves for various undergraduate and post graduate courses for CET type I. Online registrations for other courses have also been extended till June 15. Students, who have already applied in Group H/I/J/K will not have to apply again, they will be able to update their choices of programmes. The application fee is Rs 750," said Gupta. Madhya Pradesh: Home minister promises t.description: INDORE: An audio clip of a conversation between home minister Bala Bachchan and someone identifying himself as an ex-policeman, where the minister promises to look into problems faced by cops, went viral on Sunday. The caller, identifying himself as former constable Nand Kumar Chouhan, alleged that constables are posted at homes of IPS officers for household work and are expected to “drop their kids at school, salute their wives and take them shopping”. On the other hand, police stations face staff crunch and constables become ‘frustrated’ due to work pressure, he said. “They resort to suicide. You (Bachchan) had raised the issue of cop suicides while in opposition. We strongly believed that after you took over (as home minister), the situation would improve,” Chouhan is heard telling the minister. Bachchan assured the caller that he would discuss these issues at a meeting of senior police officers in Ujjain on Monday. The home minister is scheduled to visit Ujjain to chair a division-level meeting of police officers on Monday, official sources said. Though Bachchan could not be reached for comment, his office confirmed the veracity of the audio, and said the conversation happened on Sunday. Bachchan is heard telling Chouhan that he has noted down the points and will discuss them with senior officers on Monday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. \nShopItDaily grocery shopping portal or.description: It was an afternoon dedicated to ladies of Shiv Nest society, who had a gala time participating in a plethora of activities at the brunch that was organised by the ShopItDaily team. Almost 50 women had taken part in a variety of competitions, which was hosted by Indore’s one-of-a-kind grocery shopping portal.  At the do, women enjoyed playing one-minute games, which gave a fun twist to their everyday routine. Not only did they spend a delightful time, but also learnt the nuances of online grocery shopping techniques. The participants admitted the crash course will help them choose products they want on an everyday basis intelligently and also strike good deals.  The event was executed by the 14 interns of ShopItDaily, who had come up with fun activities at this brunch. The women participated in six games, and one of the highlights was the Grocery Songs one, where they had to play an antakshari of sorts by using parody of grocery items and jingles. Rashmit was announced the winner of this.  In Yes, No, Maybe, participants had to answer a slew of questions without mentioning these three words. This was won by Shikha Arya, Ropa Bagha. Ball & Pin, Safety Pin and Bangle, Tongue Twister and Straw and Ball were won by Nikharika Devi and Jasmeet Kaur, Radha Mahpa, Mansi and Ankita Semi respectively. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mandu as UNESCO World Heritage site: Dha.description: INDORE: As a first step for the heritage property Mandu to be included in the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization’s (UNESCO) World Heritage list, Dhar administration submitted a nomination dossier to the state tourism board which was unveiled by state tourism minister Surendra Singh Baghel on Wednesday. The dossier consists of the iconic heritage property’s legacy portrayed in about 2000 pages and 200 images. “We initiated the process and there are some guidelines prescribed by the UNESCO which we followed and completed the dossier in a record time of six months. We have submitted the dossier to the minister today and a team will be presenting the proposal to the state tourism board and if convinced, they will forward it to the Government of India,” Dhar district collector Shrikant Bhanot told TOI. In the next step, the state government would then be forwarding the dossier to the ministry of culture, from where it will be sent to International Conference on Operations Management and Operations Research (ICOMOR), the advisory body of UNESCO. “The entire evaluation, beginning from the state tourism board, will take place in 15 months. They will then generate a report to the ministry of culture stating if they are directly adding it to the list or any other requirement to be fulfilled. As per UNESCO, the year starts from September 30 and it will be declared by 2020-21 slot or by 2021-22 slot,” said an Indore-based consultation company’s planning and designing department head, Garima Rajput. The dossier is an inclusive effort to preserve both tangible and intangible cultural heritage of the town in the form of rich tribal culture, art, skills, festivals, cuisine, environment, fauna, rains and language. It also focuses on national and international tourism enhancement that strengthens the backbone of economic activities in the town, which further generates year-round employment activities for its inhabitants, she said. Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Relentless heat calls for night workouts.description: With the temperature refusing to budge from the forties, Malwa plateau is hotter than ever, and the dreaded wave of Nautapa has gripped the city. It is only logical then that people are preferring to stay indoors – including the fitness enthusiasts. Even though mornings are the preferred time for workouts, the scorching heat is making it difficult to carry on with gruelling fitness regimes. But the fitness freaks wouldn’t rest until they’ve had their share of workout now, would they? They opted for reversing the schedule and are preferring to carry out their fitness regime at night when it is relatively cooler outside. Be it cycling, running or trekking – fitness enthusiasts are taking to the streets, after the city goes to sleep. Just last Sunday, the much awaited Cycle Ki Marathon was organised at the super-corridor, where close to 50 cyclists pedalled 17-50 kilometers at night. It is not just events like these that have picked up pace, but even solo cyclists are preferring to complete their rides in the night. “When the city sleeps, I burn my calories on the pedal!” says college student Ayush Rikadel. He goes on to explain his reasons for choosing to hit the roads in the wee hours for cycling, “However early you may wake up to get out and cycle, the heat becomes unbearable by 7 am in Indore. So I prefer cycling in peace along the empty, cool roads until 1 am and catching the extra sleep in morning. I have an early dinner and start off with my cycle around 10-10.30 when the citizens start retiring for the day. Sometimes I come back by 12, and at other times I push myself to cover some extra miles, which is easier when the sun is not shining over your head.” It is not just cyclists who are opting the cooler night than day for fitness activities – even joggers, trekkers and marathon runners feel that night is better. IT professional Nupur Juneja puts on her running shoes post dinner and heads out for good five to ten kilometres run until midnight. “Without the sun beating down as I run, I find myself more energised and running with a better time. I complete five kilometres in a jiffy, without feeling the need to catch a break. And I feel I sleep better after a good run through the lanes of quieter Tukoganj at night.” Marathoners are also prepping for the upcoming events by practising at night. Marketing manager Ashutosh Yadav covers Indore to Dewas on weekends and he prefers doing it at night. “Since I run along the highway, I ensure that I wear the reflective gears for easy spotting. I cover a good 40-45 kilometers during this run. The best thing about practising at night is I don’t fear dehydration and heat stroke. This helps me pump in more energy and focus on bettering my time.” To make the best of these nightly runs some smaller running groups organise moonlit marathons on full moon nights. “The roads become silver and every tree, house and corner is bathed in moonlight – what could be a better motivation to run at night? For the last three full moons, we have been organising short 10 kilometer run around Residency, Palasia and Tukoganj to experience the natural nightlife. After hearing our experiences, more people have started joining in” shares an entrepreneur who organises these marathons. Likewise, night trekking is another activity that is catching the fitness enthusiast’s attention for the summer. Amish Jain, a freelance photographer and avid trekker has been organising and going on solo night treks for a while now. “The Indori city life is too crowded and noisy, even at night. To escape all that my friends and I trek to Kajligarh and Ralamandal during summer. Not only is it exhilarating to see the jungle nightlife, it is also a learning experience for survival as we stay alert for any sight of wild animals. But it is the star studded sky, away from the blazing halogens of city that truly makes the trek worthwhile.” He signs off by adding a fair word of caution for all night time activities, “Though Indore is a safe city for everyone to carry on their fitness activities at night, it is always better to be equipped with safety and first-aid tools. A small backpack with basic snacks and water along with id card and an emergency contact number is a must. And this holds true whether you are cycling or running along the city roads or trekking in the wild.” Stunt riders claim the night tooThe vast expanse of super corridor and bypass road turns into a battle ground for stunt riding at night too. Led by 21-year-old MTB stunt rider Gurpreet Singh, who has been practising wheelies on the roads for the past seven years, the stunt maniacs also make the night come alive. "I have been training to participate in international MTB stunt competition and creating a world record for the longest wheelie on a single tyre. As of now I can do 50 kms, but I am aiming for 60-70 kms to create a world record. For that, post midnight is the best time to practise without worrying about traffic and other botheration" says the ITI mechanical engineer Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. In poll year, IMC budget may not have ne.description: Indore: Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) budget for the 2019-20 fiscal year is expected to be a populists with focus on expediting ongoing development projects and no new taxes. Mayor Malini Gaud is expected to table her last budget on Wednesday before civic body elections. Official sources said that this budget would focus on improving basic amenities besides provisions for development of new roads proposed under master plan 2021. “This year’s budget will focus on improving infrastructure and speeding up ongoing development projects especially those related with road construction,” said an official. He said that projects like solar power plant at Jalood pumping station and construction of an elevated corridor at Mhow Naka would also be given approval. “Mayor is also expected to announce change in policy of commercial space owned by IMC like those in Shastri Marg, where renters have made changes in building structure to utilize the space as per their need,” said officials. “Instead of cancellation of their allotment, the renters might get an option to buy that space with a penalty,” they explained. The budget is also expected to focus on formation of a new groundwater recharge policy with involvement of private agencies to encourage citizens for rainwater harvesting. Construction of new overhead tanks to improve water supply system in outskirt areas of city is also expected to get sanction, sources said. IMC’s opposition members have also geared up to corner officials over delay in projects that were sanctioned in last year’s budget. IMC leader of opposition Fozia Sheikh Alim on Tuesday met chairman Ajay Singh Naruka and demanded to hold question hour for corporators on Wednesday. “This would save a lot of time for the second day and corporators will have ample of time for budget discussion,” claimed Alim. Naruka promised them to consider their suggestion and take it up to mayor and commissioner for approval. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Hyena spotted in IIT Indore campus.description: INDORE: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Indore authorities have alerted the forest officials after a hyena was spotted in its sprawling adjoining the jungle area in Simrol. A team of forest officials from Choral range visited the campus on Friday and found pugmarks of hyena in the campus, following which the students have been asked to remain alert, forest official said. Indore forest ranger Rasheed Khan told TOI that the choral range officials have taken stock of the situation. Two cages are kept on standby in case of wild animal's intrusion inside the campus. Students IIT Indore had a scare early this year when a leopard was spotted in the campus and later captured by forest officials by setting up a cage in January. A musical journey spanning time and seas.description: The stage was crowded, as close to 100 singers sat clothed in white. A humungous LED screen appealed to the curiosity of the audience that kept filling up the seats of Anand Mohan Mathur Sabhagraha, on Tuesday. Shortly after seven, Hindustani classical music exponent Gautam Kale took his place, and began on a melodious note of Raga Bhairav. The celebrated artistes and his shishyas performed the dawn-to-dusk ragas - from Raga Bhairav, which begins at the crack of dawn, to Raga Bageshri, that beckons the inky black midnight sky – in about two and a half hour program! As the singers took the audience through the journey of these ragas and their bandishein, the LED screen showed ambient visuals to indicate the time of the day or night, and the mood behind each. For instance, when the hundred melodiously synced voices sang the Raga Malhar, the screen lit up with visuals of rain, thunder and lightning. Similarly, during the midday raga, Raga Multani, the screen reflected an unending desert to signify the direct heat experienced during noon. “We attempted to take everyone on a musical journey of one day through the means of ragas, bandishein and some accompanying visuals. Besides that, we also depicted various seasons on Earth and some legendary ragas that have interesting tales associated with them,” shared Gautam, who conceptualised the whole program. One of his shishyas, Mahak Agrawal, who was a part of the hundred singers who took part in the program, said, “It took a lot of practice and more than a 100 man hours to piece this together. But it was all rewarded when the audience stayed glued to our performance until the very end." Apart from the classical ragas and their significance, the audience was also treated to some legendary tales and anecdote associated with some ragas. “It was a revelation for me, when I learned the story behind Raga Bisalkhani Todi. When Tansen’s son Bisalkhan was singing on his father's deathbed, the sur he voiced came to be the raga,” shared entrepreneur Naveen Agrawal, who attended the program. The crowd also cheered along when some filmy songs based on these ragas were presented by the group. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Man tries to rape three-year-old niece i.description: INDORE: A man abducted his three-year-old niece from her house, took her to a secluded place and attempted to rape her in Nahargarh of Mandsaur district on Sunday morning. ASP Mankamna Prasad said that the accused abducted the minor from her house by offering her chocolates. He was attempting to rape her when a neighbour heard her screams. “The neighbour heard the screams of the toddler and reached the spot to find the accused in an objectionable position with her. He rescued the minor and took her to his home,” said Prasad. The neighbour informed police officials and with the help of two elderly women of the locality, rushed the minor to hospital, where her medical examination was conducted. Doctors said that there was no penetration and the accused had attempted to rape her. “We have arrested the accused. He lived near the house of the minor. He was looking for a chance to abduct the minor from her home,” said Prasad adding that a case under relevant sections of the IPC and POCSO Act was registered against the accused. Bank manager, two associates create fake.description: INDORE: A bank manager and two of his associates were booked after a builder registered a case at Sanyogitaganj police station alleging that the accused had tried to defraud him by creating a fake bank account in his name when he was in Dubai and got a loan of Rs 1.5 crore sanctioned. Complainant Khurshid Khan, a resident of Almar Solitaire, told police that he came to know about the incident after he received a letter from the bank about the loan. When he inquired, he found out that a loan of Rs 1.5 crore had been initiated in the favour of his company Almas Builders and Developers by a private bank’s Chhawni branch. Police station in-charge Subodh Shotriya said, during investigation they found out that the manager and the employees had hatched a plan to get the loan sanctioned on the basis of forged documents and papers. A case was registered against the manager Rajkumar, son of Kanduram Meena, 34 and two consultants Rahul, 27, son of Mahendra Jain and Sanjeev Kanungo, 56. The complainant told police that he stayed with his relative at his home in Gurugram from August 1 to 4 in 2017 after which he had left for Dubai and returned in January 2018. “The loan process was initiated within this time period and it was then transferred to different bank accounts,” the complainant told the police. Police said that they were yet to arrest the accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Congress spokesperson pushes cop at pres.description: INDORE: Congress’s Indore spokesperson Sunny Rajpal got into an altercation with police when he was denied entry into a press conference of state PWD minister Sajjan Singh Verma here on Monday. Rajpal, who was stopped by head constable Atal Bihari Sharma, pushed the cop aside and entered the conference hall at Residency Kothi. A video of the episode went viral on social media, evoking strong reactions from BJP, which accused the ruling Congress of highhandedness and “oppression of government servants”. The policeman has refused to press charges. The video shows that the face-off between Rajpal and the cop went beyond an exchange of words. The Congressman, however, denied pushing the head constable. “I was already present at the meeting of the minister with senior officials, but had gone out to the washroom. The press conference began after the meeting. I requested the cops deployed for security outside the gates to let me enter but to no avail,” Rajpal told TOI. The Congressman, however, denied pushing the head constable, and said, “I requested him (the policeman) repeatedly. During this commotion, he got pushed due to the crowd present there. It was not intentional.” BJP city president Gopikrishna Nema claimed that such incidents have got more frequent in the six months since Congress came to power in Madhya Pradesh. “Congress leaders, in order to show their might, treat government officials as personal servants. It lowers the morale of government officials and in the end public work suffers,” Nema said. City SP Jyoti Umath said senior officers have been informed about the incident. “Head constable Atal Bihari Sharma, who is posted at Sanyogitaganj police station, was deployed outside the gates of Residency Kothi. He has been advised to give details of the incident in writing, and if he has any complaint regarding the incident,” she said. Sharma has decided not to file any complaint. “I have no personal enmity with Rajpal. I was doing my duty. I will not file any complaint,” he said. In Video:Watch: Congress leader Sunny Rajpal misbehaves with a policeman in MP’s IndoreDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPresident Group of Hotels celebrates i.description: President Group of Hotels started its couple entertainment club Melody Fusion while celebrating its silver jubilee on October 3. This mega event, organized at the lush green lawns of Hotel President Park, also announced a new, unique scheme of issuing privilege cards of President Group of Hotels to patrons. Under this scheme, members will not only get various benefits at the three local hotels of the group, but also get to enjoy quarterly mega events organized by Melody Fusion along with different food festivals boasting of Italian, Mexican, Chinese, Punjabi, South Indian, Rajasthani and Maharshtrian cuisine among others.  This inaugural event commenced with the ceremonial lighting of the lamp by Dr DP Lokwani, Vice Chancellor of Madhya Pradesh Medical Science University. This was followed by a welcome speech given by Rajendra Mehta, chairman of the group. Floral bouquets too were presented by directors of the group Shobha and Shanu Mehta. The colourful performances for the evening were beautifully woven together by the anchor Resham and featured artistes of national and international fame. Yogeshwari Mistri, winner of India’s Got Talent 2015 and 2012 winners Sonia and Diwakar performed with Ankita at the do. Singer Jasleen Mathru teamed up to perform with dancers of JP Group from Mumbai. In addition to these dance moves, viewers were enthralled by a shadow act by Prahlad Acharya from Bengaluru. Another major highlight of the event was comedian Jitesh Chawla’s act as Gutthi, which tickled the audience’s funny bone. The event was followed by a Gujarati food festival with a delicious spread of more than 40 dishes by Swati Group from Mumbai. A concluding vote of thanks was given by Ankit Mehta, managing director of the President Group of Hotels. The main benefit offered to holders of the privilege card include a discount of 30% on rooms, 15% on restaurant bills, two-nights free stay at any of the unit of the group, a lucky draw for holiday packages at hill stations and special rates for parties and marriage bookings. More than 300 couples have already registered for the offer and the target of the group is to reach out to as many as 400 to 500 couple members. This scheme of the hotel privilege card along with a membership of Melody Fusion is beneficial for company executives who come to Indore from all parts of the country but aren’t members of any such club in the city. The President Group of Hotels’ units in the city are Hotel President at RNT Marg, Hotel President Park & Service Apartments on the by-pass road and Utsav Resort & Garden Restaurant at AB Road, Rajendra Nagar.
