\nSchool Student showcase their painting.description: Students between the ages of 10-15 years exhibited their paintings during a recent charity exhibition in the city.  It marked the first time the students had participated in a professional exhibition. The students first underwent training during a month-long workshop in April and then showed off their skills here.  Renowned artists Avadesh Yadav and Shabnam graced this occasion and encouraged the youngsters. Said Yadav, “This kind of professional exposure of hosting will create a whole new group of artists who will take the legacy of this city forward. I am really happy with the work displayed by these kids here and wish them all the luck for their future.”  The kids were equally excited. Nimisha Agarawal (14), a class X student, said, “The subject of my painting is the freedom for a woman. The wings attached to her express her desire to fly freely in the sky.” Rakesh Mahajan, another 14-year-old, said, “I visited a painting exhibition in Mumbai recently and after that, I wanted to showcase my own painting at a professional exhibition and I am very happy to do it for a cause.” The money generated from this three-day long exhibition will be donated to build toilets in the rural areas of the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Lalwani wants Centre to probe Nath \u201.description: INDORE: Indore MP Shankar Lalwani on Thursday asked the Centre to investigate the “role of chief minister Kamal Nath” in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. “We all know and have learnt from media that he (Kamal Nath’s) had a role in the matter (1984 anti-Sikh riots) and it should be investigated. I will approach the home minister to consider the demands raised by Sikh community for a probe against the CM and take appropriate action on the basis of its findings,” Lalwani said after a delegation of Sikhs and local BJP leaders handed him a memorandum. Lalwani said he will ask the central government to take action against those “found guilty in the 1984 riots but are now out of jail” and probe other suspects whose name had surfaced in the case. “We will also urge the home minister to provide compensation to affected families, if any have been left out,” the newly-elected MP said. The delegation demanded that the BJP-led Union government take strict action against Congress leaders who are found guilty in the case. “The names of many Congress leaders, including Nath and Jagdish Tytler, are alleged in the riots. They enjoyed political patronage during Congress governments that ruled for many years after the incident. Since BJP has come into power with full majority, we demand that the government deliver justice,” said secretary of 1984 Danga Pidit Nyay Dilao Samiti, Mandeep Singh Chhabada. The organization’s vice-president Rishi Khanuja, a local BJP office-bearer, said that around 350 Sikh families living in Indore were directly or indirectly affected by the riots. “BJP is politicizing the issue by making false allegations against the chief minister. BJP had its government in last five years while Atal Bihari Vajpayee had also served as Prime Minister but no FIR was launched against Nath as there is no evidence of his role in the incident. Nath has thrown a challenge to bring forth if there exists any evidence against him” MPCC spokesperson Aminul Khan Suri told TOI. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

'Gumnam Hai Koi' brings marathi thriller.description: Well known Marathi actor Madhura Velankar's play ‘Gumnaam hai koi’ was staged at the DAVV auditorium of Indore on Saturday and Sunday. The drama produced by the Mumbai’s Bhadrakali productions traces the journey of a writer Revati Karkhanis in whose life a tragic incident leaves her emotionally vulnerable. She then starts facing hallucinations, strange visions. It takes the audience through a roller-coaster of emotions faced by the protagonist and other characters. The lead role was played by Madhura Velankar and the play was directed by Mangesh Kadam. The thrilling drama, was staged five times over the weekend by Sanand Nyas group, much to the delight of Indore's audience. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MP: Man held for attempting to molest fo.description: INDORE: A man was caught allegedly attempting to molest a four-year-old girl in Sanjeet village of Mandsaur district in Madhya Pradesh on Monday. The accused, Sallu alias Salim Mohammad, 45, was taking the girl into the backyard of a house when the owner saw him and raised an alarm, Nahargarh police said. Neighbours also saw the commotion and attempted to force the accused to leave the child, the police said, adding, when the accused remained unrelenting, villagers beat him up and handed him over to the police. A large crowd gathered at the police station seeking action against the accused. Senior police officials also rushed to the spot and promised quick action. Sallu was arrested under various sections of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act. The victim was sent for a medical examination. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Indore: AC manufacturers chill in the he.description: INDORE: Soaring temperature has propelled sales of air-conditioner (AC) in city and state. This season sales of AC have registered a growth of around 30 per cent. Madhya Pradesh led by Indore has emerged as a potential market for ACs and coolers. Between April and May, sales of ACs jumped by an average of around 30 per cent as against a year ago in the same period, owing to scorching summer and spate of energy efficient models in market, said leading AC manufacturers and dealers. Mukundan Menon, sales and marketing president of a leading air conditioning brand having 12.5% of market share said, “we have seen a very strong growth of 30% in sales of ACs as compared to last year. Air coolers have also registered a jump of around 50 per cent in sales.” Menon expect sales of ACs and coolers to remain good in June as well. AC manufacturers and dealers said that upgraded technologies in AC, energy-efficient models and easy finance scheme led to the spike in sales. A leading appliances and electronics company, which has its headquarters at Japan, business head (air-conditioners group) Gaurav Sah said, “Triggered by the heightened demand for cooling appliances in summer season, AC sales in Madhya Pradesh started on a positive note. We have clocked more than 40% value growth in ACs in April and May, on the back of a strong demand in the region.” Demand for inverter AC clubbed with low on electricity consumption models ruled the market, said manufacturers. Indore registered a record high temperature of 44 degrees Celsius on June 7. Prior to this, on June 3, 1991, the highest maximum temperature recorded in Indore was 45.8 degrees Celsius, according to records of Met. Gaurav Pahwa from a leading retail chain of electronics in Indore said, “besides temperature, finance has become easy with lots of friendly options that speed up the decision making of customers. Also companies have brought down cost of their products in a range that fits the pockets of customers from different walks of life.” Retailers and dealers said, with new technology, customers have become technologically advance and make purchases after enquiring about energy efficiency and type of gas used among others. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nGrafitti\u201916: Paint Your Imaginati.description: Pratibimb, the fine arts and photography club of Shri Govindram Seksaria Institute of Technology and Science (SGSITS), recently concluded Grafitti’16: Paint Your Imagination, a wide scale, open-themed wall painting event that gave the artists of the institute a canvas to explore and paint their imagination on the campus walls. The event saw participation from 26 teams of 5-6 members each who painted on the walls of parking area of the campus. This was accompanied by games, delicious food and live music and dance performances that gave the crowd a lot to look forward to. The proceedings boasted of dazzling verve and invigorating atmosphere.The competition saw Team Amigos, that painted a man’s wandering thoughts, securing the first position followed by Team Visualizers’ painting of a scene from New York city coming in second and Paint Bandits winning the third position for their painting exploring the relationship between humans and animals. The jury for the competition included cartoonist Ismail Darbar and artist Sundar Gurjar. Graffiti already has a mention in the record books and this year too, the event was planned in an attractive way leading to lasting impression on the campus. Speaking about the same, Saloni Jain, member of Pratibimb, said, “The response received was overwhelming and we succeeded in not just taking the club to a higher level but also in becoming popular among city youngsters. This was our most prominent event for the season and we hope to contribute a lot to the vibrant culture of our college.” -Kratagya Rathore Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Madhya Pradesh: Private coachings can ru.description: BHOPAL: The state government has offered private coaching institutes to run their classes in government colleges. The decision has come after 22 students died in a fire last month in a Surat coaching centre. “Campuses of several government colleges are available and can be used by private coaching institutes,” higher education minister Jeetu Patwari said on Saturday. “State government has taken several initiatives after the Surat fire accident. As part of that, it has been decided that campuses of government colleges - which are huge and safe - can be given to private institutes to run classes in the evening,” said Patwari. He added that it will be on PPP mode. Citing coaching classes being run in small and cramped places across the capital, Patwari said it is an initiative. “We will keep a tab on the outcome of the initiative,” he said. Sources said that minimal money will be charged for running the classes and that coaching centres will also be asked to cut down the fee they charge from students if they wish to avail the facility. About other modalities, Patwari said the scheme is being prepared and will be implemented soon. After the Surat fire incident, chief minister Kamal Nath on May 25, had directed chief secretary S R Mohanty to ensure that coaching classes follow the fire safety norms. It was also announced that the state government will formulate a policy in this regard and take action according to the report submitted by the chief secretary. Following the instructions, Bhopal commissioner Kalpana Shrivastava had also directed officials to ensure that coaching classes strictly follow the fire safety norms and submit a report by May 28. It is also decided that the state government will bear expenses of the students preparing for civil services. 100 students will be selected every year for it and they’ll get the support from the state government. Just like the SC and ST students, there will be free book distribution to the General and OBC category students. “A scheme is being prepared for General and OBC category students with poor financial backgrounds. They will get stationery and books worth Rs 2000,” said Patwari. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. In Video:Kolkata: Magician drowns in Hooghly while attempting underwater Houdini escape actDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Indore cops get BJP to cover up poster w.description: INDORE: A poster at a BJP rally with the face of West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee superimposed on a leopard perched in the hands of BJP general secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya, sparked a row in Indore on Tuesday. Police had to intervene and force the organisers to cover up the morphed picture. Vijayvargiya, who is credited with BJP’s stunning success in Bengal in the recent Lok Sabha elections, is leading the party’s charge for the 2021 assembly polls there. The saffron party and Trinamool Congress are locked in a tense and often bloody battle of supremacy in Bengal, and its ripples were felt 1500km away, in Indore on Tuesday. The poster was erected at Bombay Bazaar on the route of a ‘Kisan Akrosh rally’ organised by Vijayvargiya to highlight the plight of farmers in Congress rule in Madhya Pradesh. On one of the stages put up to welcome the rally, BJP minority cell leader Sajid Khan Royal had erected the morphed photo, showing Mamata in the grip of Vijayvargiya. Police took note of it and before the rally could reach Sajid’s stage, police got him to cover Mamata’s face. “We had no intention to demean the Bengal chief minister. We showed her as a tiger, but sitting in the hands of another tiger (Vijayvargiya),” Sajid told TOI. “We had a fight with the police. They gave no reason to cover the poster. But we relented as we did not want to spoil the rally,” Sajid said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Plastic ban boosts paper packaging biz.description: Indore: Blanket ban on plastic has come as a boon for packaging industry that has witnessed a growth of over 15 per cent and seen trending high with agriculture commodities and pharmaceuticals emerging as the top consumers. With stricter norms for quality packaging and food safety, demand for paper packaging has gone up, said industry players. In Indore region, a hub for agriculture and pharmaceutical units, demand for packaging has picked up among these units followed by e-commerce and fast moving consumer goods. Mohan Singh Raghuvanshi, a manufacturer of corrugated boxes said, “Packaging industry is getting good enquiries and demand as every industry is gradually moving towards paper packaging.” Industry players said, use of packaging has suddenly jumped for agriculture commodities such as for exotic fruits and vegetables among others. Rohit Jain, a dealer for fruits said, “Norms are getting stricter day by day and with this we have to ensure proper packaging of out items. Garlic, fruits and many vegetables these days are transported in proper packaging.” Paper packaging market shares about 30 per cent to overall packaging market and the share may grow in coming years. Amit Chawla, a drug manufacturer said, “Our packaging budget has gone up by about 20 per cent this year. As businesses are expanding and there are mandatory norms laid down by the government, packaging demand is growing.” According to dealers of paper in the city, local paper mills have also expanded production capacities. Recently a drop in paper prices owing to surplus supplies are seen further adding to the business of packaging amid some softening of prices. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Accused was angry over woman's behaviour.description: INDORE: Lata Verma, wife of Dr Ramkrishna Verma, who was stabbed to death by a patient at their nursing home-cum-residence in Malwa Mill area on Thursday was cremated by her family members on Friday. Dr Verma, who had gone to Delhi to meet his daughter, reached Indore on Friday morning after which the final rites were performed. On Thursday, Lata was killed and her son Abhishek was injured when he tried to save her. Accused Rafiq Rasheed, 45, was later caught by the locals. Abhishek was also allowed to attend his mother's funeral for an hour and was again brought back to the hospital. Rasheed was produced before the court on Friday and was sent on police remand for two days. The accused has severe fungal infection and was seeing Dr Verma for the past few months, say police. During sustained questioning, the accused told police that every time he used to go for treatment, he was attended by Lata and when he told her he was not satisfied with the treatment, she used to get agitated and behave badly. This had irked him and he decided to kill her. Officials are now trying to substantiate the statements given by the accused with the doctor. "The statements of the doctor were recorded. All the possible angles are being investigated," said SP Yusuf Qureshi. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Nagda to be declared 53rd district of Ma.description: INDORE: The long-pending demand to declare Nagda as 53rd district of Madhya Pradesh is likely to be fulfilled in near future since state government has sought details of three tehsils of Ujjain district and one of Ratlam district to finalize the proposal. Nagda district will be constituted by merging Nagda, Khacharod and Mahidpur tehsils of Ujjain district and Alot tehsil of Ratlam district. Ujjain collector has written to sub-divisional officers (SDOs) of Nagda, Khacharod and Mahidpur to furnish required details along with their maps by Thursday. The SDOs will submit the details in three formats. In format 1, they have to present district-wise classification of their respective tehsils with details of total number of panchayat/patwari halka (area) of rural and urban parts. In format 2, they will present details of Ujjain district post partition of Nagda, Khachrod and Mahidpur tehsils. In format 3, details of tehsil-wise patwari halka containing revenue inspector circles, number of villages in patwari halka, khasra (plot) number, area of villages and population as per Census 2011, will be provided. Besides this, details of facilities, including anaj mandi, veterinary hospital, allopathic hospital, primary health centres, schools, colleges, post offices have been sought. In 2008 assembly elections, ex-MLA Dilip Gurjar had moved an application in assembly session to declare Nagda as a district. The then revenue minister had promised him to pay attention on his demand. But, later, senior officials rejected his plea. In 2013 assembly polls, too, the issue had sought public attention. But the demand is being fulfilled now after 2018 assembly elections. “The SDOs have been asked to furnish details as required by government. The process to declare Nagda as 53rd district of state, however, will take some time,” Ujjain collector Shashank Mishra said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. JP Nadda.description: NEW DELHI: Ending speculation over the appointment of a working president, the BJP parliamentary board on Monday appointed former health minister and senior leader Jagat Prakash Nadda to the post even as home minister Amit Shah will continue to be party president. Nadda's appointment as working president was on the cards after he was not inducted into the government. Since Shah will need to meet his ministerial commitments, Nadda, as a full time party functionary, is expected to help him with the nitty-gritty of organisational tasks. "I am confident that under the leadership of Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and powered by the hard work of our karyakartas (workers), BJP will continue winning people's trust and serving our society. We remain committed to building a strong, developed and inclusive India," PM Modi tweeted. I am confident that under the leadership of Shri @AmitShah and Shri @JPNadda, and powered by the hardwork of our Ka… https://t.co/EyDidISB2W— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1560786282000Modi said Nadda is a diligent worker who has risen through the ranks due to his hard work and organisational skills. "Humble and affable, he is widely respected across the BJP family. Congratulations to him on becoming the working president of the party," the Prime Minister added. Announcing the decision, defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "BJP won several elections under leadership of Amit Shah. But since PM appointed him home minister, Amit Shah himself said the responsibility of party president should be given to someone else. BJP Parliamentary board has selected JP Nadda as working president." Modi and other parliamentary board members including Shah, Rajnath Singh, Union ministers Nitin Gadkari, Thawar Chand Gehlot and senior BJP leaders Sushma Swaraj, Shivraj Singh Chauhan and Ramlal greeted Nadda after his selection as party working president. Hailing from Himachal, Nadda (58) has held several organisational posts at the national and state level. This will be the first time the party has appointed a working president. After considerable discussion it was decided that Shah's continuance would be required in view of important state elections coming up and the party also announced a membership drive and organisational elections that will keep cadre busy for several months. Singh said Nadda will remain the working president till BJP's membership drive and organisational elections are over. Process of the organisational elections has already begun as state unit elections are likely next month. As per procedure, it takes four-five months to complete the entire organisational elections. Singh said the parliamentary board wanted that Shah should look after the party as president until organisational elections of the party are completed. "However, Amit Shah himself urged that as home minister, he can't do justice with responsibilities as party chief and wanted someone to take over after which the parliamentary board unanimously selected Nadda as working president," Singh said. Nadda was mentioned as a likely party chief in 2014 when Rajnath Singh resigned after joining the Union ministry. However, Shah took over as party president. Nadda has long experience of the party organisation as he was the in-charge of the party headquarters and is a popular figure. MP: Five held for robbing jewellers in M.description: INDORE: Mandsaur police on Monday arrested five persons, including two minors, for snatching ornaments from two jwellers after shooting and injuring one of them in Daloda area ten days ago. The accused had accosted Vikas Pal and his father Heeralal Pal when they were closing their jwellery shop in Daloda on June 7. They had shot Heeralal in his leg and made away with ornaments from the shop. Eyewitnesses claimed that six masked men were seen fleeing the spot on three motorcycles towards Mandi area, following which a manhunt was launched, police said. During investigations, it was found that the accused were seen frequenting one Anil Banchada, 27, in Banekhedi area following which a team interrogated his wife. She confessed that six friends of Anil, two minors, had visited them on motorcycles. They hailed from Pune in Maharashtra. Two teams were sent to Pune to trace the accused, but they could not be found, police said adding on Monday, the investigators received tip-off about two youths attempting to sell ornaments in Mandsaur’s bullion market. A trap was laid and the accused rounded up. They confessed having committed the crime. They led to three of their accomplices staying at a local hotel, attempting to sell the booty. Apart from Anil, police arrested Shrikant Gaikwad, 28, Ajay Rathore, 19 and two minors and recovered a portion of silver ornaments weighing 3.90 kg from them. Two other accused were yet to be arrested. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vayu cools Indore for now, temperature d.description: INDORE: After hovering over 40 degree Celsius mark for the past few weeks, temperature in Indore dropped four degrees on Thursday as a result of the effect of storm Vayu which touched Gujarat coast in the afternoon. The storm brought in high amount of moisture in western part of Madhya Pradesh including Malwa-Nimar leading to a drop in temperature and cloudy sky over the region. The maximum temperature in Indore dropped to 37.6 degree one degree above average, which was recorded at 41 degree on Wednesday. The minimum temperature was recorded at 26.4 degree as compared to 29 degree on Wednesday. Rainfall was recorded in traces by Meteorological department in Indore throughout the day. The weather department has predicted chances of rain and thunderstorm over the Malwa-Nimar region on Friday and Saturday as well, after which effect of the storm will subside leading to rise in temperature. “However, the temperature will not reach till 45- 46 degrees as one or other system will continue to bring in light rains and moisture into the region. The monsoon is likely to set in Malwa-Nimar around June 25,” Indian Meteorological department official from Bhopal said. In other districts like Shajapur, Ujjain, Gwalior, Bhopal as well, the maximum temperature was recorded below 40 degree Celsius. In Khandwa, Khargone and Dhar, the temperatures remained above 40 degree, however it was marginally lower than the maximum temperature on Wednesday in all three districts. The relative humidity across the region was also quite high on Thursday. In Indore, the humidity in the morning was 66 per cent, whereas the relative humidity in the evening was 38 per cent. While in the western part of Madhya Pradesh the effect of Vayu led to cooling down of temperature, in the eastern Madhya Pradesh rainfall activities were observed due to the cyclonic circulation over the Bay of Bengal. 'Water wars' intensify, Madhya Pradesh p.description: BHOPAL/INDORE: With water wars intensifying in unprecedented June heat, the home department has ordered police to escort all water tankers and guard water sources. While BJP says it's yet another sign of mismanagement by the Congress government, minister for urban administration Jaivardhan Singh said the decision was taken to maintain law and order after clashes were reported during water distribution in some areas. Home minister Bala Bachchan told media in Indore that police escorts are only for "sensitive places", where a flare up is possible. "This doesn't happen everywhere. I have asked officials to be alert," he said. Indore SSP Ruchi Mishra said this is already being done. "Whenever we are alerted by the administration and IMC officials about areas where there can be a flare up, we deploy police," she said. Eight people were injured in Panna on Thursday over a water battle. In Indore itself, fights broke out twice over water over the past week. Two men were seriously injured after a clash in Krishnanagar Colony of Vijay Nagar on June 5. A day earlier, a water tanker driver was beaten up by people in a Khajrana locality for not supplying them first. Home department monitoring situation: JaivardhanSuch fights have been reported from across the state, and frequently so, spurring the government to order police protection. On Thursday, the home department ordered all SPs to be alert for clashdering police protection. “We need to maintain proper supply and distribution of water in all districts. The home department is monitoring supply and keeping an eye on water sources to control any untoward incident. We are trying to keep the situation normal with the help of the home department. There is no fear among public anywhere,” Jaivardhan Singh told reporters on Friday. Officials have been ordered to “take control” of water sources during distribution. "We will keep a watch in every district to check untoward incidents during water supply. We are developing a network to collect information,” said Bachchan. This es during water supply. There have been agitations and protests against government officials at some places. Local politicians are spearheading demonstrations and egging on people to protest with pitchers and urns, say officials. The department collected feedback from collectors, police officers and PHE officials before oris yet another round in the political slugfest between BJP and Congress over supply and power cuts. “It is unfortunate that police have been deployed to monitor water supply in the state. This reminds of old days when Congress failed to cope with a similar situation. They are using police intelligence to check power cuts, district force to monitor water crisis. The government has failed utterly in serving the public,” BJP state president Rakesh Singh told reporters on Friday. The BJP has also targeted chief minister Kamal Nath, alleging that Congress leaders are “ignoring the crisis”. “The CM and minsters will have to get involved to cope with the situation but they are busy with their personal interests,” Singh said. At 44\u00b0C, mercury touches season's h.description: INDORE: Indore sizzled at 44 degrees Celsius on Friday registering the hottest day of the season, breaking all previous records. Indore is witnessing an excruciating summer with back to back records of highest temperature in June. The minimum temperature for the day stood at 28.5 degree Celsius, data from Meteorological department showed. According to records of Met department, highest maximum temperature recorded in Indore in June was 45.8 degree Celsius on June 3, 1991. Regional Met department official said that hot winds in state have led to soaring mercury that may further intensify in some parts of state. As per the forecast of the weatherman, Indore, Dewas, Ujjain and Dhar may receive light showers with lightning and heavy winds on Saturday. Khargone recorded 46.2 degrees Celsius while temperature at Khandwa and Ujjain stood at 44.5 and 44.4 degree Celsius respectively. High temperatures even at nights have left citizens disturbed as mercury is unlikely to calm down in next few days, according to weather department. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: Urging the opposition to stop worrying about numbers, PM Modi on Monday said every word of the opposition was important and all efforts should be made for a " nishpaksh" (non-partisan) approach to issues of public welfare and the larger interest of India. His remarks at the start of the first session of the 17th Lok Sabha echo his announcement on Sunday of a meeting of leaders of all parties and an informal interaction of MPs, in what is seen as a bid to break the ice after a bitter poll campaign. "The opposition should stop worrying about numbers. The people have given them a certain number. Every word of the opposition is important. When it comes to Parliament, we should forget the ruling side and opposition. We should think of issues with a nishpaksh spirit," Modi said. The Prime Minister said an active and effective opposition is a necessity in a democracy and pointed out that a well- argued and factual criticism of the government strengthens democracy. "Sometimes such positive contributions are not noticed as they do not get high TRPs," he said. Though he did not mention the media, he said highlighting such efforts would strengthen the functioning of Parliament. Modi noted that the recent elections have yielded several firsts such as the highest number of voters exercising their franchise since Independence, a high number of women voters and a higher representation for women in Parliament. "It is also after several decades that a government has been re-elected with a bigger majority," he said. Referring to his recent speeches, the Prime Minister said that "we started with ' sab ka saath, sab ka vikas', but the people have added an unprecedented 'vishwas' (trust) to the matter". He said Monday marks the the start of the first session after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "I welcome all new MPs. With them comes new hope, new aspirations and new determination to serve," he said. In Video:Oppositions' every word is valuable: PM Narendra ModiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

MP: 2 drown in Narmada river, 6 rescued.description: INDORE: Two persons drowned, while six others had a narrow escape when a group of youngsters ventured into deep waters of river Narmada in Omkareshwar on Monday. The victims, all residents of Burhanpur, were visiting the temple town to offer prayers and bathing in the river in the morning when the incident took place, Madhanta police said. Eyewitnesses claimed that the group of youngsters were screaming in playful gestures, ignoring warnings of people nearby, when one of them ventured into deep water. Another youngster attempted to reel him into the ghat, but was also pulled by the strong current. “The deceased gave been identified as Vhsial Mahajan, 18 and Ganesh Mahajan, 19,” Mandhata police station-incharge Jagdish Chandra Patidar told TOI. They were a group from Burhanpur who had moved on their motorcycles to visit Maheshwar and Omkareshwar. They reached Omkareshwar on Sunday night. In the morning, they were going to the temple, before they bathed in the river. Boats men on the ghats managed to pull the rest of the youths ashore. They also pulled the victims from water and rushed them to a hospital, Patidar said. Doctors at the hospital could not revive the victims, he added. A post-mortem examination of the bodies was conducted. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Thrillers, lyrical poetry and more at th.description: In an open stage held over the weekend, quite a few storytellers from the city presented their tales, anecdotes and stories of various hues and flavours to the audience. The range of the tales had a mix of mystery, thriller, motivation etc. This session was helmed by founders of Paint Stories, Dev and Akansha Prasad. Besides that many closet poets took the opportunity of an open stage to read out their poems. It was followed by lyrical poetry performed by the duo Hardik Shah and Akash Jangid. Mimicry and melodious songs by some other performers made the evening even more enjoyable for everyone. The open stage was organised by the group Steeters who have been promoting all sorts of art through open stages across the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Bumper arrival of onions at mandi causes.description: INDORE: Chaos witnessed at Devi Ahilyabai Fal Evam Sabji Mandi on Thursday after bumper arrival of onion crops that led to traffic jams in the area. As the state government has started purchasing onion crops at support price of Rs 800/quintal under Bhavantar Scheme, farmers of around 100km radius of the district have started reaching the mandi with their fresh crops. The number grew late on Wednesday night when the administration had to shut entry of vehicles to handle the situation. The same resulted in long queues of loading vehicles carrying crops especially onions outside the mandi while a number of trucks, which were parked inside also got stuck due to haphazardly parked vehicles. The traffic jams in and outside the mandi not only affected the business but also caused huge inconvenience to commuters. Due to the chaos, the mandi administration recorded arrival of only around 250 quintals of onion against the average arrival of around 50,000 quintal onion crops. This month, the mandi has recorded total arrival of about 4.46 lakh onion crops. The officials informed that market has capacity to accommodate arrival of 1 lakh quintal crops but on Wednesday night, over 1.25 lakh crops arrived. The traders alleged that the mandi administration has deployed 76 security guards to work in three shifts but very few of them were there to manage the traffic. “Sheer negligence on the part of mandi officials led to such chaotic situation in mandi on Thursday. There are many encroachments and no proper arrangement was made to guide the traffic. The market also lacks basic facilities including drinking water for the farmers, porters and traders,” traders’ association president Haji Maqsood said. According to mandi secretary Satish Patel, “The situation of traffic jams reported due to a sudden increase in arrival of onion crops. As decided, the vehicles carrying crops for selling/unloading in mandi will be given entry from 10pm to 9am and remaining time will be there for vehicles loading the crops and going out. A work plan is also prepared for opening a new entry/exit gate in the mandi”. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Indore: Soyabean meal exports plummet to.description: INDORE: Soyabean meal exports fell to its lowest in the season due to tepid demand from overseas players and limited availability towards fag-end of the season. Soyabean meal export in May stood at 38,000 tonnes as against 75,000 tonnes a month ago, according to the Soybean Processors Association of India (SOPA). The oil year for soyabean is calculated from October to September. Industry experts expect overseas shipment to remain weak until the season-end. SOPA executive director DN Pathak said, “This year, total exports will remain high. By end of the season, total exports are likely to touch 20 lakh tonnes as we had a good crop last year. Balance stock of soyabean meal in June is 1.148 lakh tonnes.” Since October to May, exports stood at 18.17 lakh tonnes as against 12.81 lakh tonnes in the same period a year ago, according to SOPA. Industry players expected a good opening for the new season as farmers will cultivate more lured by higher prices and encouraging exports. Consumption of soyabean in domestic market has also gone up led by poultry and industries, industry experts said. A leading exporter of soyabean meal from Indore said, “This is fag-end of the season when trend is expected to remain weak. Despite some slip in prices offtake will remain poor because we do not have good quality to offer.” Soyabean meal is offered at $450 per tonne (FOB). A month ago, exporters were offering the meal at $460 per tonne (FOB), as per three industry players. Iran was the main buyer for Indian soyabean meal in May and exporters expect it to continue purchases in the coming month as well. Madhya Pradesh is the largest soyabean producing state in the country with several large exporters of soyabean meal operating from the financial capital of the state, Indore.
